question_text: Why would a simple DVI-D to VGA adapter fail to display video on a VGA-only monitor?
answer_options: DVI-D does not carry analog signals required for VGA
VGA requires a locking mechanism not present in DVI
VGA monitors reject digital signals for licensing reasons
The adapter requires an additional ground pin not present in DVI-D
correct_answer: DVI-D does not carry analog signals required for VGA
explanation: DVI-D supports only digital output. Converting it to VGA, which is analog-only, requires an active signal converter, not a passive adapter.
